Identification_Area.title: High Gain Antenna (HGA) for Double Asteroid Redirection Test

Modification_Detail.description: Updated schema version. Adding missing "investigation" references.
Created by PDS-SBN T.F. Barnes using information provided by the Dart mission.

External_Reference.reference_text: M. Bray, "A Spiral Radial Line Slot Array Antenna for NASA's Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART)," 2020 IEEE International Symposium on Antennas and Propagation and North American Radio Science Meeting, Montreal, QC, Canada, 2020, pp. 379-380, doi: 10.1109/IEEECONF35879.2020.9330400.

Instrument.name: DART High Gain Antenna (HGA)
Instrument.description: The DART HGA is a Spiral Radial Line Slot Array that is gimballed. It is the primary antenna of DART that provides the RS data collected during the last 30 days of the mission. This low-cost, high-gain antenna enabled high-efficiency communications in a compact, planar form. DART operates at the X-band DSN frequencies of 7.168 (Uplink) and 8.422 GHz (Downlink). There is approximately a 15% difference in frequency between uplink and downlink (see Bray (2020)). The transponder delay (including RF propagation through waveguides, coax, etc.) is about 12650 nsec.
